name: Avoid direct access to Database Tables in Javascript
description: Applications should not access directly database Tables
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: Direct access to database Table prevents the control at the database level of accesses. E.g.: use of non-optimized query against the database.
remediation: Create one or several dedicated modules to access database. Encapsulate in these modules the object storing pool of connections
alternativeName: Make sure to not access the database from Javascript directly, instead create dedicated modules for the same

qualityStandards.name: Named Callable and Method Control Element with Layer-skipping Call
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid breaches of layered architecture principles due to layer-skipping references

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of layered architectures (such as strict partitioning and strict call hierarchy) decreases comprehensibility as well as simplicity to evolve the code

Measure Element
Number of instances where a named callable or method control element from a higher horizontal layer directly calls a named callable or method control element in a lower horizontal layer that is not adjacent to the upper layer making the call, as defined in a model of the application’s architectural layers (this excludes the vertical utility layers that can be referenced from any horizontal layer)

qualityStandards.name: Non-Stored SQL Callable Control Element with Excessive Number of Data Resource Access
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Detection of occurrences of this pattern helps decrease software resource waste by enforcing the use of dedicated stored procedures when multiple data access are needed.

Consequence
Software that does not leverage database capabilities to efficiently run data processing (such as stored procedures and functions) requires excessive computational resources

qualityStandards.name: Invocation of a Control Element at an Unnecessarily Deep Horizontal Layer
qualityStandards.description: The code at one architectural layer invokes code that resides at a deeper layer than the adjacent layer, i.e., the invocation skips at least one layer, and the invoked code is not part of a vertical utility layer that can be referenced from any horizontal layer.

qualityStandards.name: Excessive Number of Inefficient Server-Side Data Accesses
qualityStandards.description: The software performs too many data queries without using efficient data processing functionality such as stored procedures.
